intro: Spiesia monticola, commonly known as the mountain spurge, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils and thrives in cooler, high-altitude environments. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in cyathia, a unique floral structure characteristic of the Euphorbiaceae family. Spiesia monticola is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
